conclusion: Objects A and B are moved and lowered onto the area where blocks C, D, E, and F stand, and gravity pulls each cloth downward until it touches the upper surfaces of the tallest objects directly underneath.
Block C is orange and positioned on the left side of the table.
Block D is pink and positioned next to block C on the left side of the table.
Block E is small and green, positioned on the right side of the table.
Block F is tall and green, positioned next to block E on the right side of the table.
Cloth A is patterned and positioned above blocks C and D on the left side of the table.
Cloth B is plain and positioned above blocks E and F on the right side of the table.
Cloth A drapes over the left pair of blocks, resting first on the top of block C (orange) and then on the shorter block D (pink) next to it.
Cloth B drapes over the right pair of blocks, resting on the higher block F (green tall) and also touching the shorter block E (green small).
The pinned corners keep each cloth from sliding off the table, so both cloths come to a stop in a stable, tent-like shape around the blocks.
